title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisites: HS30072Course ContentsConcepts and Definitions; Importance of Economic Valuation of Environment; Environmental Valuation and Shadow Pricing; Types of Values for Environmental Goods and Services: Use Values, Option Values, Existence Values, Bequest Values; Market and Non-Market Benefits, Environmental Impact Assessment; Direct Methods: Market Price Methods, Productivity Methods, Damage Cost Avoided Method, Replacement Cost and Substitution Cost Methods, Physical Linkage, Abatement Cost Methods; Indirect Methods: Contingent Valuation Method, Hedonic Pricing, Travel Cost Method; Social Cost Benefit Analysis; Willingness to Pay, Willingness to Accept, Problems with CVM; Real and Hypothetical Willingness to Pay for Environmental Preservation; Alternative Approach to Valuing Non-Market Goods. Valuing the Environment as an Input; Measuring Sustainability: Green National Accounting, Genuine Savings; Cast Studies Relating to the Valuation of Forests, Water, Air and Biodiversity.
